reviewText: This really pisses me off.  They put out JEEPERS CREEPERS on Blu Ray last year and now what?  I gotta buy it again to get JC2?  No, sorry.

The Creeper is an ancient being.  Demonic appearance.  Origin unknown.  It's lived for thousands of years, feeding off the human race.

When people are afraid the creeper can smell them better, can tell if anyone has something he'd want to eat.  Whatever the creeper eats, becomes a part of it.  Eyes, hands, lungs, an entire head.  When wounded the Creeper can heal itself just by eating.  He's eaten so many hearts, that it's own may be unstoppable.

Most of the time the Creeper is asleep, but every twenty third spring, for 23 days the Creeper awakes.  It roams the land or flies above it on demonic wings.  Terrorizing people, finding food.

The creeper is an original monster and this is an enjoyable series.

This set was not 100% what I hoped for. JC 1 has a poor transfer, looks like dvd quality, granted the lighting has been upscaled, the picture is not satisfying. JC2 is even worse, it has also an ok look, but in dark areas it has some type of static effect that I have seen on a few other blurays. This does not bother me too much but with the tech we have today and how wonderful these movies are. I can accept that both have terrible menus and basicly no special features, but they should have took more time and put in more than they gave us.
If you want to at least say or have these movies on blu ray I say go ahead and get a used copy. other than that, I am not pleased.

Horror movie  with classic lines you will remember.  It keeps you on the edge of your seat.  Totally action packed with an outstanding ending. The creeper has a bit of style that makes this movie very unique.  See it.  You won't be disappointed.

MY TWO GREAT SCAREY MOVIES, THIS IT THE SCARIEST MOVIE I EVER DID SEEN, I RECOMMEND IT HIGHLY
ARNIE GRAZIANO
RIVERHEAD NY

Nothing new here but what makes them good is the fact that they're cleverly done and the actors were chosen with care to play their parts.  The slasher/stalker/monster/mutilator is well conceived with a good back story and excellently executed (as are the prerequisite youthful bodies piling up along the roadside).  The first one has Gina Phillips and Justin Long as brother and sister who first encounter our SSMM and have to deal with the outcome.  Their banter makes what could be a tedious pedestrian exercise in horror come alive and the "Guy" who trips their nightmares is scary enough to make Charlie Brown stay out of the Pumpkin Patch, believe me.  Look for the late great Eileen Brennan in one of her last roles making a nifty cameo-esque appearance in the first one.

The second one ups the youthful bodies quotient by making the object of our "Guy" a school bus full of high school kids and stands out as a sequel by being less of a sequel and more of a stand alone. Jonathan Breck returns (I should have mentioned him for the first one because he does a 'bang up' job playing the SSMM)and wreaks more mayhem upon our hapless teens.  Ray Wise is the biggest name in it at the time (late of Reaper as the Devil) and is always good.  But the kids carry the film all the way and you'll recognize several of them as well.

I highly recommend both movies and they look and sound great in Blu-Ray.

People stop weeping and moaning.

1.  Some have complained about the special features.  How many times do you watch special features.  Most times the special features are not in blu-ray format anyway.

2.  There are legal issues that delay or even prevent movies from being re-issued in any format.  If you look at the executive producer credits you will see that the list is significantly different.  These are the investors.  There is always negotiations return on investments and whether they have rights to any re-releases.  After all movie production is big business.

3.  Just for your info Twilight Time has been purchasing the exclusive rights to the limited distribution of many popular and rare movies on and blu-ray.  Once they are gone the price goes up by as much as 500% because they are then considered collectors items. So just be glad that this set is only $14.99.

First off, I read some reviews that said that both movies were on one disc, well this isn't true, you get two discs.

Secondly, Jeepers Creepers 2 has none of the extras ported over from it's DVD counterpart (NONE!!!).

What a flippin' rip!!!

So be warned.
I found this combo set of Jeepers Creepers 1 and 2 a nice addition to my movie shelf. It arrived quickly enough and in good repair and made some pretty cool watching.

Yep, they should have went combo from the start.  The stand alone BD of the original movie is now selling for practically nothing and I hadn't even opened mine yet.  It's not even worth the bother of reselling.  I guess I'll just give it to a friend and get the combo.  Along with the combo, they could have released the second movie alone for those that already had the original. I gave it 4 stars because of the movies themselves and not the way they were released.
